page.title: 01RURAL HEREFORDSHIRE. WILLEY
page.content: Willey is a rural area of great beauty. Population 42. Dwellings 34. 25 dwellings are directly concerned with livestock raising, plus some cereal production. 9 other dwellings are empty or residents work from home as landscape designer, architect, builder, artist. One resident commutes to work as a poultry sexer. Willey farmland is 250m to 350m above sea level and is designated a Less Favoured Area, attracting government subsidies. Consumer goods, recreation facilities, are available at Presteigne 6km, Knighton 7km, Ludlow 6 Leominster 22km, Hereford 40km. A small general store is at Lingen 1km. Farms owned mainly by 2nd 6 3rd generation of a family; stock rearing replacing crops as the farmer ages.There is electricity, no mains water no sewage.
